title: Is there anything else I should do before I commit suicide besides write a note? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re going to die anyway and you can kill yourself at any time, why throw away what life you have? I mean, you’re only going to experience this thing once and then you’re going to fall into the darkness and never be heard from again. There’ll be plenty of time for death later. Why rush it? You can kill yourself tomorrow. Mayo Clinic research found that after a failed suicide attempt, the odds of someone desiring to commit suicide again, decrease dramatically: After a Suicide Attempt, the Risk of Another Try I’m not saying what you’re feeling isn’t real. Quite the opposite; what you’re feeling is very real. But you’re feeling is emotion. It’s your brain being a bully to you when it’s supposed to be helping you. I think somewhere between the first thought of suicide and the actual act, most people realize they don’t want to die but they also don’t want to continue living the way they are. So, they find some deep hidden strength to confront their demons/life problems and change them by any means necessary. Even now, you wouldn’t be asking this question if you wanted to die; You’d just go do it. Like I said earlier, you can kill yourself any time. You can do it in a straightjacket, in a car, even under the most powerful sedatives in the world and not a single person can stop you — if you’re meticulous enough. But you can’t choose to live any time you want. Once you’re dead, you’re dead. You can’t revive yourself in an ambulance or in a boat or in anything. Someone else has to do that for you. I’m not trying to tell you what to do — you do you. If you think suicide is going to solve all your problems, go for it. But it would appear — from this question — that like everyone else, you’re wired to want to survive. Good for you! You’ve gotta find that fire though which says you’re going to live by any means necessary and hold onto it. Skip the whole self-doubting phase. Just decide: This is my life and I’m going to live it how I want. I’m going to think things through and accomplish what I want. Live for today; You can kill yourself tomorrow. Go get some help and stop trying to find it from people on the Internet who know nothing of your situation. In this climate, therapists may not be affordable but support groups are on every corner. They lurk in churches, covens, secularist societies, philosophy buildings, etc. Anywhere where the falling angel meets the rising ape, you’ll find a group of people looking to push past their life’s problems.

Call an ambulance. That would be the best lst thing. You can always write the note later or even not have to worry about it. There is hope. Trust me I know! Remember too that the person committing suicide. YOU-will cause much pain and hurt to each and everyone that has known you in your life. That was a big wakeup call when an ER nurse mentioned that to me. Sure you are in horrible pain. But, it’s temporary. It really is. You will get through this! Call a suicide hot line. They can give you easy simple help until you get safe. Really, love yourself, take care of yourself. Suicide is a permanent end to a temporary problem. So don’t make that mistake. National Suicide Prevention Lifeline Call 1-800-273-8255 Available 24 hours everyday
